antiPatterns.name: Cyclic Dependency
antiPatterns.description: A cyclic chain of calls between microservices exists.
antiPatterns.detection: The existence of cycles of calls between microservices; e.g., A calls B, B calls C, and C calls back A.
antiPatterns.consequences: Microservices involved in a cyclic dependency can be hard to maintain or reuse in isolation.
antiPatterns.solution: Refine the cycles according to their shape, 4 and apply the API Gateway pattern.
antiPatterns.example: A depends on B, B on C and C on A
sources: @article{taibi2018definition, title={On the Definition of Microservice Bad Smells}, author={Taibi, Davide and Lenarduzzi, Valentina}, journal={IEEE software}, volume={35}, number={3}, pages={56--62}, year={2018}, publisher={IEEE}, doi={10.1109/ms.2018.2141031}}
